bioghist.p: William Donald Williams was a professor of Chemistry at Harding University from 1954 to 1993. He is the author of many articles on chemical history and biography, and wrote the "Old Chemistries" articles in the Bulletin for the History of Chemistry. He and Wyndam Davies Miles together assembled a collection of books, which they gave to Harding University in Searcy, Arkansas.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of additional materials ("duplicates and discards") from the Miles-Williams collection at Harding University; they were donated to the Chemical Heritage Foundation in 1998. The collection consists mainly of reprints of articles on a wide range of topics related to the history of science, primarily chemistry, and individual scientists. A number of the articles were written by Miles. There are a number of reprints pertaining to Western and East Asian alchemy. There are also a number of chemical society membership lists, programs, and histories and chemistry magazines. The collection also contains non-published items, including: a World War I-era notebook from the Chemical Corps; a binder of typed and manuscript letters; loose letters and receipts from chemical, pharmaceutical, and apparatus manufacturing companies and university professors; correspondence related to public lectures given by Miles; and some correspondence between Miles and WIlliams about items in the collection; and correspondence between Wyndham Miles and Denis Duveen, a chemist, chemical historian, and noted collector of books on alchemy and early chemistry.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
